verbLexeme: 1. To be unwilling to consider new ideas or other people's opinions. English = (be) narrow-minded, (be) small-minded.
2. To disapprove of behaviour and opinions which are different from your own. English = (be) intolerant.
nominalLexeme: 1. The condition of being unwilling to consider new ideas or other people's opinions. English = narrow-mindedness, small-mindedness.
2. The disapproval of behaviour and opinions which are different from your own. English = intolerance.
